column5: My wife and I had a 2 month wait to get ours from 1st of Aug.
Went to Canada first week of July. Received my card three weeks ago. Wife has yet to receive hers.
We were in Canada on July 25th and received our cards today, October 21st. -Jeff

My wife and I got ours this Monday and we were up on July 10th. Both had a wrong number for our street address. So I looked at the paper they gave us and I can't blame them for getting it wrong. I couldn't read it either. Suppose I will have to call it in.
Received the first corrected card today.
Received the second corrected card today - good to go thru 2011.
Was in Canada last week in May and received the card over the weekend.
The wife and I were in Canada July 4 and we received our cards this week.
Was in Canada the first week of September and received my card last Wednesday.
What is the purpose of the Outdoor Card? And do you still need to buy a license every year? Just wondering.
Bought one for my son and I January 1st 2009. Received both in the mail mid September.
I applied in Dryden, ON June 6th and received mine the week of Sept 7th.Hunter1943
I don't know why we need an outdoor card but still need to buy a fishing tag every year. Maybe I'm missing something. Can someone explain? Thanks.
Revenue(Money) Later, Jay
Was there the 3rd week of June and just rec'd our Outdoor Cards in the mail this week.
My family was in Canada 6-14 recieved our 4 cards today

Got my card the middle of Sept. Went to Longlac and stopped at Skinners Bait shop--the first one he had seen--ran it thru the machine for the fast track printing of my lic. IT DIDN'T WORK Prints a three copy and it only printed two. go figure.
Applied for ours in Perrault Falls 6/20/09 and received them yesterday.Thank you,Larry Mac
Bought ours third week of July received cards first week of Oct
I was there June 15th Card came in maillast week!!!
Was in Canada 1st week of June. Received my card last week!
To AllMy cousin and I purchased ours on January 9th, received on September 14th, dated 2011.Paul
Purchased mine Feb 5th and received Sept 14th
puchased jan 9th rec'd today..... passports are 2-3 weeks right now in canada fishing cards for 1 province 9 months....oh well not that important
My wife and I purchased ours on July 4th and received them today, dated 2011.
Bought 4 of them July 7 and got them today
Wife and I purchased our 2nd week in June. She received hers 3 weeks ago and mine arrived today.

I posted yesterday that my wife and I received our cards. Got to looking closely at them last night and found mistakes. Both our eye colors were wrong, my height was listed at 154 centimeters (5') when I'm actually 6'1" and my wife's gender was listed as male. Called the 800 number this morning and was told that these corrections are important and they will re-issue cards in about 20 days. Call took a total of about 5 minutes of talking to a very pleasant and accommodating lady. I suggest everyone take a close look at all the info on their cards to make sure it is accurate.
I too just got my cards(from a mid-July fishing trip) in the mail and it is wrong both weight and eye color. Guess I will have to call...

That's height in centimeters that is on the card - not weight. I don't see weight at all. I caught the mistake because they showed my wife at 160 cm and me at 154 - found a conversion table and figured out I was only 5' tall.
Im glad I kept reading this thread..I thought the 180 on my card was weight..but the conversion is accurate for my height..I wish I my weight was only 180

I ordered my license over the phone March 30th, received the license and temporary paper Outdoors Cardabout April 14th. Got the Outdoors Card today... However, I noticed that the card expires December 31, 2010....only a 2 year period. I thought it was to be 3 years. I think I'll call the 1-800 number unless someone on WC can explain . Thanks, JDP
So the last two numbers in what looks like a credit card number are 10 and not 11?..if thats the case I would call them
ours also expire in 2010what gives with that ? only 2 years and not 3
Bought mine May 16th---received it yesterday, Sept. 14th. Mine expires 2011.

The last two numbers are "10". I called the Outdoors Card Centre (1-800-387-7011). Apparently there were cards incorrectly printed with only two years of life. There were supposed to be pulled and replaced before being sent to recipients. I will be receiving a new card in 20 days with an expiration date of 12/31/2011. The call took less than 3 minutes. JDP
just called and will recieve news cards in 3 weeks also
so you DO NOT need one prior to arriving in ontario for a trip, correct? planning a possible trip with mattice lake outfitters next summer and want to be legal.

Correct! The way I understand it: The OC will allow the purchase of the 2010 fishing license over the internet or at the very least over the phone in 2010. I believe you will still be able to purchase the fishing license at a retailer and get a temp OC (paper) when you purchase a fishing license in Canada as you always have. You do not need to do anything before you leave. JDP
Mine came yesterday, the 14th. Expires 12/31/11.
Bought ours May 10 and it also shows 2011. Do you suppose if it was purchased prior to the season starting that it's considered 2008, 9 and 10? Doesn't make sense does it?
Bought ours July 4th and haven't received them yet.

We bought our licenses on the way up in Wawa. Not sure if it matters or not, but we had to pay cash for the licenses. Was told they no longer accept credit cards. Needless to say, ran short at the card table once we got to camp however, we did get our outdoors card the day we got the licenses. wonder why with so many out there still without theirs........???
Did you get the actual plastic card, or the temporary paper slip? The outdoor card I received in the mail is like a credit card in size....
Mine came on Sept 7
The Cedar Rapids area has been flooded with them. Most folks I know got their actual card this week. Bill Krejca
Card are here!
Got mine in the mail today! Paid for the card and license back in March, finally got what I paid for!
bought mine in may-came in today
I ordered mine in March and the plastic card came in the mail today
I got mine tyoday, bought the license last december

________________________________We go through this thread about every month! See https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...t=outdoor+card.It's a great idea, especially for the camp owners and bait shops that sell licenses. If I start complaining about another $3.00 per year to go fishing in NW Ontario, someone please tell me to stay home where I belong!
I have been waiting since early June and was led to believe I would have it in time for my Sept. trip............yea like that is going to happen!

I called the toll free number on 1/27/09 and charged it to my credit card, the temporary paper one came in the mail 3 days later. The permanent (3 yr) plastic cards are supposed to be mailed out before the end of the year. You should call the MNR at 1-800-667-1940 and see why theres a hold up on your temp.

Just a quick update for all of you looking for your outdoor card. My son and I went to Gullrock in June and we just received our cards in the mail yesterday. Those of you looking for yours for a September trip my be in luck before you leave. TonyO
Just received mine in the mail also. Was up on LOTW in July, and going back up next Friday.Brett
If the money goes to maintaining or improving the fishing on Ontario I got now problem. Heck, I'd pay more.
Bought mine May 29 and got it in the mail yesterday. Be patient, they're coming.
Bought mine January 9th. I still do not have my card.

I just called the MNR and the lady stated that if you don't recieve by 12-31-09 to contact them and they will look into it. My cousin and I both purchase ours in January also. The number is 800-667-1940.Paul
We were up June 20th and just got mine last week.
How long is it taking to get the outdoors card in the mail?? I was up July 10th.
A previous thread said, if you bought it along with your license after arriving in Canada, it would be mailed out in the fall. I was there from July 4th-11th and haven't received mine either.
Was there week #1 in June and have not received card yet.
what is an outdoors card?
Was there the second week of the season (late May) and no card yet. Just hang on to the receipt they gave you. Govt. there works about as fast as ours does.

Its part of Ontarios (don't know aboot the other provinces) modernization of their licensing system. You will need it in order to get a hunting or fishing license. The cost is $9 and it is good for 3 years. You can get one by calling 1-800-667-1940 and charge it to your credit card or you can get it where you buy your license in Ontario. This will be a temporary paper form. The plastic cards should be issued by years end.
got my lic in janwere up ice fishing !still no outdoor card blue
I bought my license in January and paid for the card and still no card
It sound like a new way to squeeze another $9.00 out every angler. w/o raising license fees.
............ it's EVERY angler. The Canadians are complaining about them too.
